about.name: Oslo
about.info_text: Oslo, the capital of Norway, is a vibrant and modern city located at the northernmost tip of Europe. Nestled between the Oslofjord and lush green hills, Oslo offers a unique blend of nature, culture, and history. Visitors can explore the city's many museums, including the Munch Museum, dedicated to the famous painter Edvard Munch. The city is also known for its stunning natural landscapes, such as the Oslofjord, forests, and islands, providing ample opportunities for outdoor activities and relaxation.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 700,000
Country: Norway
Time Zone: Central European Time (UTC+01:00)
Language: Norwegian
Currency: Norwegian Krone (NOK)
about.climate_text: Oslo, the capital of Norway, has a temperate maritime climate with four distinct seasons. Summers in Oslo are relatively mild, with temperatures typically ranging from 15°C to 25°C (59°F to 77°F), while winters are cold, with temperatures between -6°C and 2°C (21°F to 36°F). Oslo experiences moderate rainfall throughout the year, with snowfall common in the winter months.

attractions_card.title: Vigeland Park
attractions_card.description: Explore the world's largest sculpture park created by a single artist, Gustav Vigeland. The park features over 200 sculptures, including the famous Monolith and the Wheel of Life.

attractions_card.title: The Viking Ship Museum
attractions_card.description: Discover well-preserved Viking ships, artifacts, and historical exhibits that provide insight into Norway's Viking heritage.

attractions_card.title: Holmenkollen Ski Museum and Tower
attractions_card.description: Visit the world's oldest ski museum and experience the thrill of standing atop the famous Holmenkollen Ski Jump, offering panoramic views of Oslo.

attractions_card.title: The Royal Palace
attractions_card.description: Admire the official residence of the Norwegian monarch. While you can't enter the palace, you can witness the changing of the guards ceremony.

food_card.title: Gravlaks
food_card.description: Indulge in gravlaks, a traditional Norwegian dish of cured salmon served with mustard sauce, bread, and dill. It's a delicacy you must try.

food_card.title: Koldtbord
food_card.description: Experience the Norwegian koldtbord, a lavish cold buffet featuring an array of seafood, cold meats, cheeses, and more.

food_card.title: Brunost
food_card.description: Try brunost, a sweet brown cheese that is uniquely Norwegian. It's often served with waffles or crackers.

hotels_card.title: Grand Hotel Oslo
hotels_card.description: Stay at the iconic Grand Hotel Oslo, known for its luxury, history, and central location. It has hosted numerous celebrities and dignitaries.

hotels_card.title: Scandic Holmenkollen Park
hotels_card.description: Nestled in the hills above Oslo, this hotel offers stunning views and is close to the Holmenkollen Ski Jump and Museum.

hotels_card.title: The Thief
hotels_card.description: Experience modern luxury at The Thief, a boutique hotel on Tjuvholmen Island. It offers contemporary design and waterfront views.

transport_card.title: Oslo Metro
transport_card.description: The Oslo Metro provides efficient transportation within the city and easy access to attractions, including Holmenkollen and Vigeland Park.

transport_card.title: Ferries and Boats
transport_card.description: Explore the Oslofjord and nearby islands by taking a ferry or boat ride. It's a scenic way to experience the region's stunning natural beauty.
